

```{r, BimodalFaithfulHistoChangeBins, fig.align="center", fig.width=6.25, fig.height=2, fig.cap="Histograms of the waiting times between eruptions for the \\textit{Old Faithful} geyser; changing the bins can change the impression of the distribution. Left: sensible number of bins. Centre: too many bins. Right: too few bins. For all histograms, boundary values are counted in the lower box.", out.width='100%'}
par( mfrow = c(1, 3))
#     mar = c(5.1, 5.1, 2.55, 1.5) + 0.1) 
right <- FALSE

data(faithful) # Built-in dataset

hist(faithful$waiting,
     main  = "'Old Faithful'\nwaiting times",
     sub = "Sensible number of bins",
     xlab = "Waiting times (in mins)",
     ylab = "Frequency",
     xlim = c(40, 100),
     ylim = c(0, 60),
     right = right,
     las = 2,
     breaks = 12,
     axes = FALSE,
     col = plot.colour)
axis(side = 2, 
     las = 2)
axis(side = 1,
     cex = 0.9,
     las = 2,
     at = seq(40, 100, by = 20))

hist(faithful$waiting,
     main  = "'Old Faithful'\nwaiting times",
     sub = "Too many bins",
     xlab = "Waiting times (in mins)",
     ylab = "Frequency",
     xlim = c(40, 100),
     right = right,
     las = 2,
     breaks = 60,
     axes = FALSE,
     col = plot.colour)
axis(side = 2, 
     las = 2)
axis(side = 1,
     cex = 0.9,
     las = 2,
     at = seq(40, 100, by = 20))
